function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Assuming a time-dependent function for the Wiener process may lead to inaccurate estimation of the transmission rate.","Impact":"Incorrect estimation of transmission rate could result in ineffective disease control measures.","Mitigation":"Use additional data sources and verification methods to cross-validate estimated transmission rates.","Technologies":"Statistical modeling, machine learning algorithms.","People":"Epidemiologists, public health officials, researchers.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health agencies."},{"Description":"Overfitting the model could lead to inaccurate distinctions between the latent trajectory of transmission rate and noise in observations.","Impact":"Misinterpretation of transmission rate dynamics and ineffective policy decisions.","Mitigation":"Regular validation and adjustment of model parameters, use of regularization techniques to prevent overfitting.","Technologies":"Machine learning algorithms, cross-validation methods.","People":"Data scientists, epidemiologists, statisticians.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health agencies."},{"Description":"Using a constant transmission rate assumption before the first lockdown may not accurately capture the changing transmission dynamics.","Impact":"Misrepresentation of actual transmission rates and ineffective prediction of disease spread.","Mitigation":"Incorporate historical and real-time data to capture changing transmission dynamics, use dynamic modeling techniques.","Technologies":"Dynamic modeling algorithms, data assimilation methods.","People":"Epidemiologists, modelers, public health officials.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health agencies."}]}
